channel.title: theBalancedBriefNLtech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from theBalancedBriefNLtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Tech in the Classroom: A History of Hype and Hysteria
item.description: From calculators to ChatGPT, the introduction of new technology into schools has long inspired frenzied discourse: Will it revolutionize the system or...

item.title: How Microschools Became the Latest Tech Mogul Obsession
item.description: Between homeschool provisions in the One Big Beautiful Bill and Trump’s attempts to gut the Department of Education, teaching kids looks different now...

item.title: The Tweens Down Under: Life Without Social Media in Australia
item.description: As Australia rolls out a ban on social media for kids under 16, tech companies face steep fines and teens face life without TikTok, Instagram, and oth...

item.title: Teachers Are Trying to Make AI Work for Them
item.description: Since the start of the AI boom, teachers have been tasked with figuring out if LLMs are helpful tools or a cheat code. This is how they’re bringing AI...

item.title: The Best Tech for Back to School
item.description: From laptops for any kind of coursework to scooters to get you to class on time, here's everything you need to crush this school year.

item.title: ‘Stranger Things’ creators may be leaving Netflix
item.description: Netflix could soon lose the creative team behind one of its biggest hits, with the Duffer Brothers reportedly signing an exclusive deal with Paramount...

item.title: Duolingo CEO says controversial AI memo was misunderstood

item.title: GPT-5 is supposed to be nicer now
item.description: OpenAI announced late Friday that it’s updating its latest model to be “warmer and friendlier.”

item.title: Judge says FTC investigation into Media Matters ‘should alarm all Americans’
item.description: A federal judge has blocked the FTC's investigation into Media Matters research around advertising and antisemitic content on X.

item.title: AI-powered stuffed animals are coming for your kids
item.description: Do A.I. chatbots packaged inside cute-looking plushies offer a viable alternative to screen time for kids? Maybe not.
